Threads.Reply_Text: It's as if Linus is afraid when those companies take over, they'll discover all the things buried underneath the carpet.

Replies.Reply_Text:
Literally came here to say this. Turning down $100m on principle seems less likely to me now than Linus knowing the company had skeletons in the closet that he knew would surface as soon as any serious buyer conducted their DD.

I don't work in M&A or any transactions quite like this, but I do work in an area where my job is to conduct diligence for large (multiple tens of millions of dollars) deals - one of the first things we do in our full DD process is identify and talk to leavers about why they left.

I believe the process of buying a business involves unearthing the buried skeletons before finalizing the deal. I guess he thought it was not a good idea to let someone look in there and say "no thanks". That's why he decided to improve it and I think he genuinely thought he was going to do that. But then the second lab update video came out and they basically did fuck all. That's when I realized that Linus is way in over his head and is definitely not handling it properly.

I work at a company that had DD conducted for an investment from an external party. I can confirm it's pretty thorough (though the people that handle tech questions really didn't know their shit). This would not be hidden for much longer
But you can’t disclose to the public what skeletons you have found.
But the deal would fall through.
I guess thats what he means by big companies coming in and ruining his image...
super common with start ups... lots of shit gets just hacked together and people disappear super quickly and the rest is left to shovel the shit they left

But.... For that people need to disappear... And they don't. The core team is still there Nick, Luke, Colton, Jon, Ed etc. The few that left all had valid reasons like not having a higher ceiling/type of project (Brandon), moving away for a new phase in life(Taran), following a different passion(Nicky V).
i assume most of them are in managerial positions? Why would they leave? They're probably insanely well paid and now have others shovel the shit they left

Some are just by growth, but some are still writers, editors or  backoffice staff. Tbf, I don't think anyone at LTT has a shit pay else they wouldn't be there if everything would be so bad as the crowd is believing.

you should really read something on this subreddit other than my comments... they're literally paid right above the average in an area where they can't even afford rent with that pay....

People work there because they want to work with/for their idol... and people take shit paying jobs all the time... you know humans need shelter and food and clothes and those cost money right?

So.... What's wrong with above average? Also. They clearly can afford to live there else they would not live there? Sure it would be nice if they earn more, but above average is better than 50% of the population. I don't see you raising pitchforks at smaller companies etc... Just now LTT because we'll the band wagon is there.

I haven't seen one shred of proof that they are treated that poorly besides the accusations from the pitchfork crowd.

I just see employees that based on actual statements from actual employees outside of company time(their own social media etc) or within vids some didn't even know LTT before they worked there. They just saw a decent job.

There are also a lot of employees with decent cars, a house, a job they like, hobbies outside of work that cost a shitload(I for example follow an employee that builds custom keyboards, not a cheap hobby)

If I were you I would put down the pitchfork and look at the facts and not feelings

> but above average is better than 50% of the population.

not really how an average works... in salary or in general... back to like 8th grade when they teach statistics... you might want to pay attention this time

give me one piece of evidence someone who has been groped at work could have... thank you...

Oke fair median. But hey they still earn in that bracket if it's screws(back to 8th grade?)

Someone who could have been groped at work can file a complaint, at the department of labour, the police, a therapist etc. However this is not in the scope of our discussion. We were talking about salaries.

If we pull open that can of worms. Within LTT there are multiple woman who worked there for longer in different positions (backoffice, camera work, presenter etc) most of them still work there and as far as I can tell do their jobs very well. They can just leave if it's that bad.... I know 1 that left because she wanted to focus on photography.

ohhh she only has to show her medical records... that's totally reasonable you're right...

and of course they can just leave if they want.... and they'll eat that can of worms you just opened they buy with the imaginary salary they will get when they don't have a job? And they can even use it as a house when they can't pay rent! You're maybe the most privileged and at the same time stupidest comment today
The real reason was the due dillegence process you have to go through when you're being bought by an investor

Threads.Reply_Text: Linus loves to give off the impression that it’s not about the money but now we know it absolutely is. The only reason he didn’t sell is because it wasn’t enough money for his greedy ass

Replies.Reply_Text: Really? I thought the constant merchandise and add cuts in the videos made it obvious...

I mean I can look past that. The man and the staff needs to eat. The constant stress on the cogs (staff) of his video producing machine just to muster out the maximum amount of income possible is what’s messed up.
Feel like that might have been a management problem, maybe they hired too many people

They definitely hired too many people and didn't have a proper system set in place. This reeks of bro culture and a lack of HR nor a PR team. The sexual harassment, terrible expectations of how many videos need to be put out constantly and responses to all the allegations just show how bad LTT really is.

Rather than apologize to Billet Labs in PR 101, they doubled down until GN came out. The experiences that Madison faced reminds of me of Blizzard and Riot Games when female employees came out with similar experiences. I really can't see LTT the same anymore, they lost a lot of trust in the community.

The fact that HR is lumped in with other things like logistics, events, sales, marketing and procurement as "Business Operations" honestly explains a lot. For an expert on all of those things, it would be a demanding field to cover effectively for a business at half the size of LTT.

Colton simply doesn't seem qualified to lead HR at an organization of this scale, and the rest of the management team (with the exception of maybe Terran, we'll see) don't seem qualified to realize it.
What a not surprise that you can’t just place some guy in a chair or get your wife to be your head of HR and expect things to run peachy keen. The company is ran like a shit local small business.
LOL, honestly you're not wrong at all. The only difference is that they're a big company now and they're acting like a mom and pop shop who abuses their employee's.

I work in HR and and all the shitty and most toxic ones were the ones where HR was someone’s relative or wife or friend. None of them were qualified and they’ll take it out on you if you have more experience than them. This sounds like LMG.

Yeah, for what they're attempting to do they need a much bigger team or they need to scale down on operations severely and start cutting off areas that aren't needed. It's clear they're biting more than they can chew.

I feel bad for Terran, but I do hope with his experience he navigates this better. No one likes HR but they exist for a reason. lol they definitely don't have a PR team because Linus is such a big fucking liability for the future of LTT. He needs to retire and gtfo.

This plus the financial black hole that is Labs. They went far too deep on that idea and now it's a giant threat hanging over their collective heads that they need to get as much revenue as possible or they're fucked.
I thought it was the millionaire real estate he just bought…
The continuous videos of his house almost made me quit watching the channel for good. Why are his employees being forced to work on his house, presumably on company time?

Lol that reminds me of the time I was forced to help my boss with stuff around their house even though it had nothing to do with my job. Even if you are doing it on company time, it felt like crap cos you are being used like some kind of manual labour slave.

Without being too douchey there is a lot of home tech with snake oil claims and they had a great opportunity to tackle some of those.

It is a reasonable area to cover for a tech channel.

They could have done home tech upgrades, or long term reviews but on their staffs houses. That would have been cool.

There is also an element that Linus's house has been part of the show forever. Like right back in the early days when he did the whole house water coolong build.
That house was the LTT office, not Linus private residence
But hey, he can’t loose a couple hundred bucks in employees time to redo a test of a product…

I mean, you're just describing a company. They're not doing this as a hobby, they're trying to make money. That I get. It's the fact that he tries to pretend otherwise, pretending like money is just a 'pesky little thing' that they have to deal with just so they can make fun videos and 'do what they love,' that's when I don't get it.

Well I think people expected Linus to be above maximising profits as he already had a lot. It seems that he wasn't and things got out of hand but perhaps he was always like this and think now people are starting to think that he was always greedy.

Always hated this about their channel. It has gone completely down the drain for years on end. Excessive advertisement and sponsorships. Videos that just end without a proper conclusion. Tons of errors. He is as desperate to milk the audience as any corporation he’d love to make fun of himself. But as long as he’s the one getting the money it’s all good.

> Excessive advertisement and sponsorships.

Fortunately, [SponsorBlock](https://sponsor.ajay.app/) exists to clean all that up.
If Linus considers AdBlock as piracy (lmao), wonder what he thinks of this…
I realized it started going down hill when they started having prebuild pc sponsors. like what the actual fuck? I watch so I can have the knowledge to build my own, not have an Ad shoved in my face
Dont forget about the new 24/7 stream for said ads to play
Imagine constantly talking about how you already have enough money, but your actions speak how you can’t get enough.

And don’t want to spend $500 (or $100 like he suggested) to retest inaccuracies. Past 36 hours have ripped open so many shitty details and I’m all for it. Dude is dumb for even having the stance not wanting to sell because he wants his image to stay clean, yet it would be so much better of an image to start a channel and sell the company for 100m and retire before what 35-40? How old is he? Yeah, zero sympathy for any of them.
That's not even the biggest issue atm w/ Linus, with Madisongate hitting the scene and the MindChop situation.
and its always 'his' money, as if he has to write the checks from his personal bank account.

That's every boss/owner I've ever had. They act like their workers' labor isn't the very thing bringing in all that money to begin with.
Linus would be nothing without his employees. I'd hope that if any one thing comes from this, it would be LMG workers unionizing. But I'm not holding my breath.

the smartest of workers would leave since they know everyone at ltt is replaceable, and i'm sure linus reminds them of that quite often. I don't think they have enough pull to create an effective union.

You'll never change your boss's way of running things, and if you dont' like it, leave.

Its hard, and it sucks, but its the best thing to do for yourself.

> You'll never change your boss's way of running things, and if you dont' like it, leave.

Bullshit, because unionization can and does. Teamsters recently elected a new president, ousting the legacy Hoffa. Then by threatening to strike, very recently got a new contract for UPS that is a significant pay increase, and addressed several other concerns, such as air conditioning in all new package cars, ending the two-tier wage system, etc.

It's hard, and it sucks, but the best thing to do for yourself as a worker is to unionize.
Bro, it wasn't about the money, it's about the fact that he wouldn't be in control anymore.

This. I’m sure it would hurt to see a company you founded turn into something you were no longer proud of (see, Steve Jobs and Apple), but Linus not selling is more to do with the fact that the $100 million buyout isn’t *dramatically* more then he thinks he could earn by maintaining his role as sole owner of the company.

To put it more bluntly, he wouldn’t have refused a billion dollar buyout.
The $100M figure probably required him to spend five years bringing profits up to $20M or something like that. If that type of profit was feasible, might as well keep the company.
No way 20 million profit would bring you evaluation up way more than 100 mil. Revenue maybe but not profit.
I love the amount of times he has claimed to be “tight fisted” in his brand new Porsche parked in his mansion that he is entirely remodeling.
Seems more that it's also about power and control

any non insane person would have taken that 60 mill in a heartbeat.

the only reason anyone would turn down a check for generational wealth is because of their greed and ego.

if 60 mill wasn't enough, nothing would be enough.
Not if you love what you do.

I think the problem here is that people (including their company) are confusing "loving what you do" with being "competent at what you were hired to do." How many dumb, easily avoidable mistakes were made by people at the highest levels of responsibility for the company? Mistakes that just should not happen.


"Oh, he turned down the money because he really loves what he's doing. That makes all the sense in the world. Why set your children, and even your children's children up for life when you can love what you do?"

But none of us know his financial situation. We know he invested 250k of his own money into Framework. So maybe he has other avenues that will keep.his kids in clothes and hot meals.

Anyway, just because people can't grasp really doing something you enjoy it doesn't make him a fool for not taking a payout.

Hes a fool for other reasons.
I can totally grasp doing something you enjoy. I can't grasp something I enjoy more than 60 million dollars. That's a me problem.
So this sub is just making shit up now?

except it wasn't, was it? the money are clearly going to the company and not in his pocket. the openness with which he talks about various quite personal things is admirable. so don't be a shithead, don't lie and don't make it black and white, it's called [false dilemma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/False_dilemma)
Oh shut up man. He was flexing the 3 teslas on twitter implying how much money he earns that he can pay salaries like that.
Flexing with the cars of his employees.... Yes... That makes him rich.... The one who pays them... He would be shit if they drove Citroen C1 and he would drive a Lamborghini.

Two of those employees are senior management, the other bought it before joining. All of his job posts are below 70k CAD (52k USD). And this is in one of the most expensive cost of living areas in the world.
70k CAD? I thought a few years ago his whole shtick was that "my employees can afford to buy a house where they work"
I don’t know how that is possible unless they relocated to another city. And even then, Canada is having a housing crisis, many young people will never own a home in this country.

first, hearsay. second, you know what Linus is, you've seen him. he likes to be childish. and he has a deep passion in tech. it comes natural that he's excited to try as many new tech things out as possible. don't forget he has walked us in his own house repeatedly, shown how he lives. shown us his family. have you seriously gotten the impression that his ass was particularly greedy there? you can nitpick small and stupid details within any person, it doesn't make Linus the evil virus of satan.

Dude do you think Keanu Reeves can dodge bullets because he did so in the matrix too? It's an on screen persona... you don't know Linus... neither do we... he could literally be kicking puppies in his free time for all we know
Keep drinking that copium soda, bud.
He owns plenty of property, companies and for some weird reason badminton courts... he definitely goes to his own pockets wtf
